                       Overview
                       The training on the Production Terminal modules is designed for employees
                       working at the corresponding registration points on the shop floor.
                       We are going to convey to the users how our software shall help him perform
                       his work more efficiently and more easily, and what to do in case of defects etc.

                          Required knowledge
                          Basic IT knowledge and/or Windows knowledge are prerequisite for using
                          the corresponding modules. The user has to know what the physical work
                          processes and process steps at the terminal in question look like, and how
                          to execute them. Basic IT knowledge and/or Windows knowledge are pre-
                          requisite for using the corresponding modules. The user has to know what
                          the physical work processes and process steps at the terminal in question
                          look like, and how to execute them.


                       Tutorial Structure
                       This tutorial consists of sets of topics with several sessions each. Each ses-
                       sion consists of the following parts: This tutorial consists of sets of topics with
                       several sessions each. Each session consists of the following parts:

                       Overview                   Each training session starts with an overview of the
                                                  major topics:
                                                  • Objectives: What shall be conveyed?
                                                  • Benefit: What can this knowledge be used for?
                                                  • Maxims: Which correlations are to be remembered?

                       Concepts                   Concepts and terms of the corresponding training
                                                  session will be explained first. This is followed by
                                                  examples and operating instructions. Concepts and
                                                  terms of the corresponding training session will be
                                                  explained first. This is followed by examples and
                                                  operating instructions.


                       Reading instructions
                       The contents of a learning unit are based on the knowledge conveyed in the
                       previous unit. We therefore recommend that you do not skip any learning
                       units.
                       If you are already familiar with a subject you should at least read the summary
                       at the start of the session in order to bring the main details to mind.
                       The practical part of each training unit automatically includes the software ref-
                       erence and the exercises on the cross references. This will provide a central
                       thread through the entire documentation.

                        Production Terminal Systems
                        The Production Terminals are software modules of the production control sys-
                        tem A+W Production that serve to check, enter, modify, control, and divert pro-
                        cess steps in the work flow.
                        The Production Terminals visualize and control individual processing steps
                        and can be configured individually. Labels and reports can be printed online at
                        all Production Terminals; rejects can be entered with all the necessary infor-
                        mation. Handling the Production Terminals is easy and uniform. These intelli-
                        gent systems enable you to inform your customers of the current state of his
                        products at any time.

                        landscape:

                       Goals of the Production Terminal Tech-
                       nique
                       The following goals shall be achieved by means of the production terminal
                       technique:
                       •   Scheduled and optimized jobs or batches are distributed to the appropriate
                           workstations.
                       •   The workers at the machines are provided with graphical information on all
                           relevant details of the lites (shape, alignment, sizes, processing).
                       •   The work performed is booked.
                       •   Deviations from detailed scheduling are registered.
                       •   Scheduled and actual production processes are compared during produc-
                           tion.
                       •   The production process is visualized.
                       •   Remakes (due to rejects) are created automatically.
                       •   The workers at the machines are provided with all relevant information on
                           the lites (shape, alignment, sizes, processing).
                       •   The production process can be re-optimized manually.
                       •   The collected data are used for analyses.
                       Each of the production terminal modules provides special support for one of
                       these goals.

                           Performance counter
                           In the Production Terminals, additional fields can now be displayed that
                           show the produced quantity, area and linear meters for a certain time at a
                           recording point (e.g. a shift). Please contact an A+W employee.


                       Operation of the Production Terminals
                       To use the production terminal technology to the best effect, barcodes are reg-
                       istered in all relevant places. The appropriate workstations or machines are
                       equipped with barcode scanners. A barcode scanner is firmly allocated to a
                       workstation (registration point). Barcodes serve to identify production factors,
                       processes, or states such as:
                       •   Lites (individual or groups)
                       •   Racks
                       •   Employee
                       •   Processing
                       •   Rejects
                       If a rack barcode is scanned for example, the software will book the corre-
                       sponding rack automatically to a defined processing station.
                       If the same scanner is used to scan a lite barcode, the software books the lite
                       e.g. to the currently registered rack.
                       System configuration defines the actions to be performed automatically upon
                       scanning the barcodes.

                        Using Production Terminal IG-In
                        Objectives

                        •   Introducing the user interface of Production Terminal IG-In.
                        •   Getting to know and understanding the operation
                        •   Correct handling of intermissions
                        •   Being able to handle unforeseeable situations (e.g. shortage in material)


                        Benefit

                        Production Terminal IG-In supports you when it comes to loading the lites of a unit
                        from rack to the IG line in the correct sequence. To work efficiently you have to
                        understand the functioning of the program; you must also be capable of handling daily
                        recurring situations.


                        Definitions

                        Barcode                      Are opto-electronically readable signs consisting of
                                                     parallel lines and gaps of different width.

                        Batch                        Amount of items scheduled and produced together.

                        Lot                          Amount of parts that are processed together on the
                                                     same machine.

                        Remake                       Lite that has been recut due to rejects or a defect.

                        batch                        Amount of goods with identical properties. Example: a
                                                     barrel of butyl. Amount of goods with identical
                                                     properties. Example: a barrel of butyl.

                        Rejects                      Defective lite that cannot be used.

                        Production number            Defines/shows the production sequence within a batch.
                                                     Example: production number 22 is the 22nd IG unit to
                                                     be produced.

                        Scanning                     The term Scanning defines the registration of one or
                                                     more barcodes.

                        Book                         The Booking process writes and saves certain data in
                                                     the database.


                        Note

                        Intermissions                Must be recorded, always.

                        Rejects reasons              Have to be documented always.

                       Handling of defective lites
                       It may happen that you cannot produce the lite suggested by the module be-
                       cause the lite is defective. You will have to mark the lite accordingly in this
                       case. Causes of defects can be:
                       •   Rejects
                       •   Defect (quality assurance reason)
                       •   Scratches
                       •   Wrong sizes
                       •   Wrong glass type
                       •   Cracks
                       Remakes will be automatically created for Rejects, scratches, and Cracks.
                       This means that when rejects occurs somewhere on the shop floor and is duly
                       scanned, the corresponding lites will be automatically moved to a so-called re-
                       jects pool, to be cut again as soon as possible. In case of the Wrong size and
                       Wrong glass type the cutting of remakes is not required. This is why no re-
                       makes will be created for these two rejects reasons.
                       In case of a Defect the worker's superior must decide whether this is accept-
                       able or has to be removed. Example: There is a scratch on a lite that can be
                       removed by polishing. Based on this flag you can create reports that serve for
                       quality assessment.


                        Handling of defective lites
                       1 Select the lite in question.
                       2 Press the [Rejects] button.
                       3 Dialog Status opens.




                       4 Choose the appropriate reason from the list.
                       5 Press [OK].

                       Remake management
                       In production it can happen that components are not completely broken, but
                       can still be used in part. This can happen when assembling IG, for example, if
                       only one lite is broken or reveals damage and another (expensive) lite can be
                       reused. In addition, it can happen that processings must be repeated with a
                       single glass (e.g., a coating must be washed off and the lite must be re-coat-
                       ed). Since in both cases the product is not completely broken, we call this a
                       Partial reject.
                       In the remake management, you can decide for such partial rejects which parts
                       will be reused, which processings must be repeated, and how the defective
                       parts can be put back into production.
                       There are the following options:
                       •   Reuse
                       •   PS remake
                       •   Direct re-production

                       Reuse
                       If the defect in the rejected lite/unit can be eliminated so that the lite/unit does
                       not have to be re-produced, select the [Reuse] option. With the button [F3], the
                       Processing dialog opens. There you can specify to which registration point the
                       lite/unit should be booked so that it is easier to find in production later on. On
                       this dialog you can also specify which processings should be repeated.
                       PS remake
                       If there are complex processings on the defective unit, it can be helpful to re-
                       plan it completely. In this case, use the [PS remakes] option. With it, you can
                       generate a completely new item in the order pool. The quantity of the old pro-
                       duction item will be reduced so that the total quantity of the order item matches
                       again.
                       Direct re-production



A+W Production Production Terminal                                                                 L-1327
Overview Production Terminal: IG                                                                   Tutorial




                        If you want to cut the lite again without new planning, select the [Direct re-pro-
                        duction] option. This way, the lite will be booked into the reject pool of the A+W
                        Realtime Optimizer so that it can be re-cut right away.

                        Procedure

                        Detailed annotations on the individual sections
                        Sections (A), (D), and (E) in Production Terminal Manual Cutting are the same
                        as those sections in Production Terminal IG-In, which is why they are not de-
                        scribed in detail at this point.

                        Section B - Work list
                        This section shows all released batches or lots for the corresponding table.
                        The contents of this view is based on the filters (section C).
                        Field Batch shows the batch number. Field Lot shows the lot number within the
                        batch. Field Glass type contains the glass name. Field SD is the stock size. If
                        Production Terminal Ma-nual Cutting is used at a manual cutting table, field SD
                        shows -1. This is due to the fact that manually cut lites have not been opti-
                        mized so that there is no stock size. Field ProdDate shows the production
                        date. Field Thick includes the lite thickness. Field Piece shows the quantity
                        and field Shape, the shape number. Field Machine tells you on which table this
                        glass type is to be cut. Field Text shows further details.

                        Section C - Filter functions
                        Section Filter offers four combo boxes that can be used to restrict the contents
                        of the view. In the top right combo box, the table intended for Production Ter-
                        minal Manual Cutting is selected by default. You can choose another table any
                        time, then press the [Refresh] button, and the view is adapted to the new filter.
                        The combo box below is set to Not ready by default. This means that only
                        glass types will be displayed that have not been released yet. Should you have
                        released a batch by mistake and it has vanished from the view, you can open
                        the bottom left combo box and select the entry Ready. To update the view,
                        press the [Refresh] button.
                        You can use the combo box Filter 2 to display individual batches. Select Batch
                        and enter the corresponding batch number in the following field. You can also
                        view a sequence of batches. In this case, select from the combo box Batch
                        from ... to ... then enter in the next field the first batch number to be shown and
                        in the following field, the last batch number to be displayed. Press the [Re-
                        fresh] button.

                           Delete the filter
                           To delete the filter, open the combo box and select the entry ---. Remember
                           to press the [Refresh] button.

                        Operating sequence
                        The operating sequence in Production Terminal Manual Cutting is:
                        •   Start module Production Terminal Manual Cutting.
                        •   Log in (<Name>).
                        •   Choose the batch to be released.
                        •   Release the batch.
                        •   Assign a rack.
                        •   Book the batch.
                        •   Rejects pool: Add a broken lite by hand (optional).
                        •   Rejects pool: Delete a lite (optional).
                        You have to record every interruption of your work at the machine. Reasons
                        for an interruption may be:
                        •   .Machine maintenance.
                        •   Machine failure.
                        •   Breaks.
                        If a lite you are about to book proves to be defective you have to book the
                        cause of the defect as well. Causes of defects can be:
                        •   Rejects
                        •   Scratches
                        •   Cracks

                        Register at the workstation
                        The registration process is the same for all workstations. It is described in de-
                        tail in section Production Terminal IG-In.
                         Tutorial, “How to register” on page L-1308


                         How to select a batch
                        1 Choose the batch.




                        2 Now press the button [Release [F5]]. Dialog Release appears.
                        3 This dialog lists all lites separately, i.e. if you have selected a batch of 64
                          lites in the main window, dialog Release lists these 64 lites individually. By
                          default, all lites are selected.
                        4 You can now either book all lites in the view, or select individual ones by
                          mouse-click.
                        5 Go to field Rack and enter the rack number, or scan it. If the rack is empty,
                          check the checkbox Start.
                        6 To book the lites, press [Produce].




L-1340                                                            A+W Production Production Terminal
Tutorial                                               Overview Production Terminal Manual Cutting




                        How to book the selected lite(s)
                       1 Choose the required lite.




                       2 Go toe field Rack and enter the rack number, or scan it. If the rack is empty,
                         check the checkbox Start. If you are using a scanner, you can also scan the
                         barcode Start.
                       3 Enter a charge name (optional).
                       4 To book the lites, press [Produce].


                        How to add rejects by hand
                       1 Open the dialog Reject entry.
                       2 Go to field Order and enter the order number.
                       3 Enter the item number in field Item. Section Parts shows the parts belong-
                         ing to the order and item number in question.
                       4 Open the combo box in section Reject Reason.
                       5 Choose the reason for the rejects, e.g. scratches.
                       6 Go to section Barcodes and choose the lite you want to add.
                       7 Press the [Save] button.
                       8 The dialog closes. You will find yourself in dialog rejects pool, which in-
                         cludes the lite you have booked just now.


                        How to delete a lite from the rejects pool
                       1 Open the dialog rejects pool.
                       2 Choose the required lite.




                       3 Press the [Delete] button.
                       4 The lite is deleted. The dialog remains open.

                       Using Production Terminal Order
                       Objectives

                       •   Introducing the user interface of Production Terminal Order.
                       •   Getting to know and understanding the operation
                       •   Loading orders and items
                       •   Choosing the right parts (main part/sub-part)
                       •   Correct booking of quantities.
                       •   Learning how to cope with unforeseeable situations (e. g. rejects)


                       Benefit

                       Production Terminal Order can be used to load and book large quantities at once.
                       This saves time and helps to minimize errors.


                       Definitions

                       Parent                        Parents are the superior part. They have part number
                                                     0, e. g. IG.

                       Sub-parts                     Sub-parts are subordinate parts. They have part
                                                     numbers 1, 2, etc., e. g. float glass.


                       Note

                       Select the right part         Please remember to select the right part for booking.

                       Registration points without   Parts can be booked to registration points that include
                       processing                    no processing, e.g. sorting.

                       Reset                         Use this button to clear the view.

                       Green check item              The processing has been performed already.

                       Red X icon                    The processing is still open but cannot be performed by
                                                     the registered machine.

                       Detailed annotations on the individual sections
                       Sections (A), (F), (G), and (J) in Production Terminal Order are identical with
                       the sections in Production Terminal IG-In, which is why we are not going to ex-
                       pound on them at this point.

                       Section B - Search fields
                       This section serves to select the order item. There are three options.
                       •   Enter the order and/or item number in section Order data. If the order con-
                           sists of just one item, entering the order number will do. Now press [Enter]
                           or the [Search] button. The data will be loaded.
                       •   Scan the barcode. The data will be loaded.
                       •   Enter the barcode in field Label. Now press [Enter] or the [Search] button.
                           The data will be loaded.

                       Section C - Filter
                       To book a lite to a registration point you have to register the registration point
                       first. Open the combo box Reg. point and choose the appropriate registration
                       point.
                       Field Processing shows the processing types allocated to the selected regis-
                       tration point. Booking the registration point also means booking the corre-
                       sponding processing step.
                       Section Filter also influences the preview list. The contents of the preview list
                       depends on the selected registration point and on the checkboxes checked or
                       unchecked in section Parts/Processings.
                       Example: Order item consisting of three IG units, registration point: IG line.
                       The three IG units are displayed.




L-1354                                                           A+W Production Production Terminal
Tutorial                                                           OverviewProduction Terminal: Order




                       Change the registration point: Cutting. All sub-parts of the IG units are dis-
                       played.




                           Choose the right parts
                           When booking the items please make sure to select the right part (parent/
                           sub-part). The corresponding parts are already adapted to the registration
                           points. Still, it can happen that you cannot book the processing steps de-
                           fined by default. Example: Cutting, different glass types.

                       Section D - Quantity overview/Booking area
                       Order items can be selected in two different ways.
                       •   Go to table Overview and select the required item(s) by a double-click. The
                           quantity in field Book is adapted accordingly.
                       •   Go to field Book and enter the number of items to be booked. After pressing
                           the [Enter] button, the order items are selected from table overview, from
                           top to bottom.
                       Field Open/Done shows the number of open processing steps. 3/0 means that
                       there is a total of 3 lites that still need to be processed (or lites that have not
                       reached the registration point yet) whereof 0 have been performed.

                           Registration points without processing
                           If a registration point includes no processing (e. g. sorting), this field shows
                           no entry. Still, lites can be booked to such a registration point.

                       Field Rack can be used to enter the rack name (optional) or scan the barcode.
                       The lites will be booked to the defined rack. If you have got an empty rack,
                       check the checkbox Start. This makes sure that the rack does not contain any
                       booked lites. If you are using a scanner, you can also scan the Start barcode
                       followed by the rack.




A+W Production Production Terminal                                                                 L-1355
OverviewProduction Terminal: Order                                                               Tutorial




                       Section E - Preview
                       This section offers a preview of all the order items that were not booked yet.
                       Field Pcs shows the quantity. Field Label contains the label number. Field Or-
                       der displays the order number and field Itm., the item number. Fields Width
                       and Height show the lite sizes of this item while field Glass type represents the
                       glass type. Field Customer tells you who has ordered the items. Field
                       Reg.Point shows the whereabouts of the lite. If this field is empty, the lite has
                       not been allocated to any registration point so far. Field Rack tells you on
                       which rack the lite can be found. If this field is empty, no rack has been as-
                       signed yet. Field Prod.Date shows the production date and field Part, the part
                       number.

                       Section H - Shape preview with zoom function
                       This section shows the shape preview for the selected lites.
                       The [Zoom] button can be used to enlarge the shape preview. When you press
                       this button, dialog SNLive appears, showing the enlarged shape.



                       The print icon can be found in the bottom left corner of the screen. Press this
                       button to open the print dialog.




                       Dialog SNLive can be closed by pressing the [Close] button.




                       Section I - Processing list




                       This section shows a list of open processing steps. Processing steps highlight-
                       ed in green mean that the processing step can be performed by this machine.
                       If the processing shows a green check, it has been executed already. A red X
                       means that the processing still needs to be done but cannot be done by the
                       registered machine.

                        Tutorial, “Module Presentation: Production Terminal IG-In” on page L-1303

                       Operating sequence
                       The operating sequence in Production Terminal Order is:
                       •   Start module Production Terminal Order.
                       •   Log in (<Name>).
                       •   Enter the order number, or scan it.
                       •   Enter the item number or scan it.
                       •   Choose the target registration point.
                       •   Allocate a rack (optional).
                       •   Book the order item(s).
                       You have to record every interruption of your work at the machine. Reasons
                       for an interruption may be:
                       •   Machine maintenance.
                       •   Machine failure.
                       •   Breaks.
                       If a lite you are about to book proves to be defective you have to book the
                       cause of the defect as well. Causes of defects can be:
                       •   Rejects
                       •   Scratches
                       •   Cracks

                       Register at the workstation
                       The registration process is the same for all workstations. It is described in de-
                       tail in section Production Terminal IG-In.
                        Tutorial, “How to register” on page L-1308


                        How to register a registration point
                           To book a lite to a registration point you have to register the registration
                           point first.




                       1 Scan the corresponding barcode or open the combo box Reg.Point.
                       2 Choose the required registration point. The processing types assigned to
                         this registration point are shown in section Processings. This step is unnec-
                         essary if you are using a scanner; the data will be loaded automatically af-
                         ter scanning the registration point.




A+W Production Production Terminal                                                               L-1357
OverviewProduction Terminal: Order                                                            Tutorial




                        How to register a rack
                       1 Enter the rack number of the physical rack or scan the barcode.
                       2 If you have got an empty rack, register the rack then check the checkbox
                         Clear rack. If you are using a scanner, you can also scan the barcode Start.


                        How to produce the unit/lite
                       1 Enter the order number, or scan it.
                       2 Enter the required order item(s). The order is loaded and appears in the
                         preview.
                       3 Choose the required registration point or scan it.
                       4 Enter the rack number (optional).
                       5 Check the checkbox Start [F11].
                       6 Enter the batch (optional).
                       7 Go to field Book and enter the required quantity or select the corresponding
                         items from the preview by means of a double-click.
                       8 Now press the button [Produce [F5]].


                        How to clear the view
                       1 You can clear the display anytime.
                       2 Press the [Reset] button.
                       3 The display is blank now.

                       Input of charges
                       The input of charges is described in detail in the chapter on Production Termi-
                       nal IG-In.
                        Tutorial, “How to define batches” on page L-1320

                       Changing the machine status
                       It may be necessary to interrupt an ongoing production process. Reasons for
                       this may be e. g. machine maintenance or breaks.
                       The chapter on Production Terminal IG-In describes in detail how to change
                       the machine status.
                        Tutorial, “Changing the machine status” on page L-1310

                       Handling of defective lites
                       It may happen that there is a lite on the line that you cannot use because of a
                       defect. You will have to mark the lite accordingly in this case.
                       The handling of defective lites is described in detail in the chapter on Produc-
                       tion Terminal IG-In.
                        Tutorial, “Handling of defective lites” on page L-1311

                       Detailed annotations on the individual sections
                       Sections (A), (G), (H), and (I) in Production Terminal Processing are identical
                       with the sections in Production Terminal IG-In, which is why we are not going
                       to describe them here in detail.

                       Section B - Label and rack number
                       Field Label shows the lite's label number. The number can be entered via key-
                       board or barcode scanner.
                       In the field behind you can enter (optionally) the rack name or barcode. The
                       lites will be booked to the defined rack. If the rack is empty, check the check-
                       box Clear rack. This makes sure that the rack does not contain any booked
                       lites. If you are using a scanner, you can also scan the barcode Start.

                       Section C - Information on the lite




                       The field on top shows the glass type of the lite for every item (e.g. float 4 mm).
                       The lite size is shown below.

                       Section D - Information on the finished product




                       This section shows the name of the finished product.

                       Section E - Order data




                       Field Order shows the number of the order to which the lite belongs. Field Itm.
                       shows the item of the customer's order. Field Qty. provides the number of lites
                       ordered by the customer, per item.
                       Field Del.Date shows the delivery date. Field Customer provides the customer
                       name.



A+W Production Production Terminal                                                                L-1363

                       Combo box Output defines the registration point the lites are booked to when
                       being Produced. Please remember to register the selected registration point.
                       Field Code shows the driver allocated to the registration point that will be load-
                       ed automatically If no driver has been allocated you can choose one by open-
                       ing the combo box Code.

                       Section F - Preview
                       This list shows all lites to be produced. You can also load a whole supply of
                       lites and produce them. The first lite is always the lite currently displayed.

                       Section G - Work list
                       This list shows all lites to be produced. You can also load a whole supply of
                       lites and produce them. The first lite is always the lite currently displayed.

                       Section J - Buttons
                       The buttons [Produce], [Skip], and [Reject] are identical with the buttons in
                       Production Terminal IG-In, which is why we are not going to describe them
                       again at this point.
                       The button [Empty view] is identical with the button [Reset] in Production Ter-
                       minal Order and is therefore not explained in detail here.
                       The [Code] button serves to load the driver for processing the lite. The lite still
                       remains in the view. After pressing the [Produce] button, the lite is booked to
                       the exit and disappears from the view.

                       Section K - SN sketch
                       This section shows the order item as a sketch complete with sizes.
                       Click on the sketch to open it in full screen mode. To close the full screen
                       mode, press the [Close] button in the bottom right corner of the screen.

                       This combo box allows to display different SN views. The view will be updated

                       1 Enter the rack number (optional).

                       Using Production Terminal TG-In
                       Objectives

                       •   Introducing the user interface of Production Terminal TG-In.
                       •   Getting to know and understanding the operation
                       •   Loading of furnace beds.
                       •   Learning how to cope with unforeseeable situations (e. g. rejects)-


                       Benefit

                       Production Terminal TG-In supports your work at the furnace entry by a graphic
                       display of the furnace bed load. This results in the optimum use of furnace capacity
                       and saves money.


                       Definitions

                       Turn                          The turning of lites.


                       Note

                       Scanner operation             Production Terminal TG-In is mainly scanner-operated
                                                     Notes on mouse operation can be found in the
                                                     appropriate places.

                       Furnace beds                  There are 15 furnace beds that are numbered.
                                                     Example: 01 is the first furnace bed, 08 the eighth.

                       <F11>                         If you have just one monitor, you can use <F11> to
                                                     switch from one view to another (main window/furnace
                                                     bed).

                       Alert window                  The alert window automatically appears if there are
                                                     processing steps still open before the tempering
                                                     process.

                       Turning and moving lites      Lites can be turned on the furnace bed by means of the
                                                     mouse, and moved to the next line.

                               Module Presentation: Production Terminal TG-In
                               Production Terminal TG-In is a control unit installed at the entry of the temper-
                               ing furnace. It is used to register all lites there that are loaded into the contin-
                               uous furnace or the batch furnace. Information supporting the production of
                               the selected lites is displayed as well.
                               This includes the graphic display with lite shapes and sizes, plus order and
                               customer information.
                               Production Terminal TG-In consists of two dialogs: Production Terminal TG-In
                               (main window) and the furnace bed. The two dialogs are designed for two-
                               monitor operation. If you have just one monitor you can use <F11> to switch
                               between the two dialogs.

                       Replacing damaged lites
                       One lite of a unit may be damaged. If you have already booked 'good' lites for
                       the unit in question, you can replace the damaged lite by the next matching
                       lite. This can either be done automatically or you can scan the barcode of the
                       lite that is to replace the damaged one.
                       The procedure is as follows:
                       •   Book the first good lite.
                       •   Book the second good lite.
                       •   The third lite is defective. Use the [Rejects] button to book this lite.
                       •   The lite remains in the view and is marked accordingly.
                       •   The barcode number of the lite reported broken is replaced by the next in
                           the item sequence.
                       •   You can also scan the next lite, in which case the barcode number of the
                           lite reported broken will be replaced by the scanned barcode number.

                       Operating sequence

                       for an interruption may be:

                       •   Machine failure.
                       •   Breaks.

                       cause of the defect as well. Causes of defects can be:

                       nal IG-In.

                       It may be necessary to interrupt an ongoing production process. Reasons for

                       the machine status.

                        Using Production Terminal Edit
                        Objectives

                        • Getting to know the user interface of Production Terminal Edit.
                        • Getting to know and understanding the operation


                        Benefit

                        Production Terminal Edit supports the booking of large quantities in the shipping area.
                        This saves time and money.


                        Definitions

                        Source data                  Source data are data to be rebooked.

                        Target data                  Target data are the data to which the source data shall
                                                     be booked.

                        Header part                  The header part of a bill of materials (e. g. IG).

                        Sub-parts                    Sub-parts of a bill of materials (e.g. float 4 mm)

                        RP type                      Short for 'type of registration point'.

                        Reg.point                    Short for registration point

                        Stat. type                   Short for status type

                        Sections (A), (F), and (G) in Production Terminal Edit match the same areas

                        Sections B and E - source data and buttons
                        There are various options for loading the source data. Source data can be
                        loaded for the following areas:
                        •   Registration point type (group of registration points, e. g. production area).
                        •   Registration points (tables, manual cutting, goods received, etc.).
                        •   Racks (existing racks).
                        •   Order (existing orders).
                        •   Label (existing label numbers).
                        •   Batch (existing batches).
                        Choose the requires entries from the combo boxes in the appropriate areas,
                        e. g. the entry Off site in section Registration point. To load the data, press the
                        button [Add].

                        Section C - Filter function
                        These two checkboxes can be used for restricting the view. You can have all
                        parts (of the BOM), only the header parts (of the BOM), or only the sub-parts
                        (of the BOM) displayed. Next to the two checkboxes there is a combo box
                        showing the firmly defined types. This can be used to restrict the view even
                        further. Example: You want to see only the sub-parts of an IG unit. Check the
                        checkbox Sub-parts and choose the entry IG from the combo box.

                        Section D - display of source data
                        When you have made your selection in section Source, press the button [Add].
                        The data will appear in this section.

                       The operating sequence in Production Terminal Edit is:
                       •   Start module Production Terminal Edit.
                       •   Log in (<Name>).

                       The registration process is the same for all workstations. It is described in de-
                       tail in section Production Terminal IG-In.

                        How to load a registration point
                       1 Go to field Reg.point, open the combo box and select the appropriate reg-
                         istration point. Alternatively, you can enter the first number of the registra-
                         tion point. This will produce a list of all registration points starting with this
                         number.
                       2 Choose the required registration point.
                       3 Press the [Add] button.
                       4 The data will be loaded.


                        How to load a rack
                       1 Go to field Rack, open the combo box and select the required rack. Alter-
                         natively, you can enter the first number of the rack. This will produce a list
                         of all racks starting with this number.
                       2 Choose the appropriate rack.
                       3 Press the [Add] button.
                       4 The data will be loaded.

                         How to load an order, a batch, or a label
                        1 Decide whether you want to load an order number, a batch number, or a

                          Order, batch, or Label.

                         How to book a lorry off-site
                        1 Go to section Source and open the combo box Reg. point or RP type. Se-
                          lect the entry Lorry.

                        8 Press the [Adopt] button. The data will be booked.

                           Should you have booked data by mistake you can move them back from

                       Also called pull-down menu. To create e.g. a house front, click on the menu

                       Key combinations
                       Hotkeys are keys or key combinations that are used to call a command or ex-
                       ecute a function. Hotkeys will help the skilled user to achieve the required re-
                       sult quickly. A list of the major hotkeys and function keys is shown below:

                       Hotkey                    Explanation

                       [F1]                      Use this function key to enter a batch. Dialog Manual
                                                 input appears.

                       [F2]                      Press this function key to load a new lot. Dialog Load lot
                                                 opens.

                       [F3]                      This function key serves to change the machine status.
                                                 Dialog Status appears.

                       [F4]                      This function key is used to register a person at a
                                                 machine. Dialog ToolTV registration opens.
                                                 You can also use this key to switch between different
                                                 screens.

                       [F5]                      Press this function key to book the status produced for
                                                 the current unit.

                       [F6]                      Press this function key to skip the current unit and
                                                 display the next unit to be produced. No booking wil be
                                                 made.

                       [F7]                      Pressing this function key books the current lite as
                                                 Reject. Dialog Status appears.

                       [F8]                      Press this function key to load a remake. Dialog Load
                                                 remakes appears.

                       [F11]                     This function key serves to load another production
                                                 number. Dialog Go to production number opens.

                       [F12]                     This function key starts the preview. Dialog Preview
                                                 appears.


                          Active and inactive buttons
                          You will find that there are the active and inactive buttons in the individual
                          menus. These buttons are enabled or disabled depending on your entries!

                   Closing the program
                   There are various ways of closing the program.

                       Notes on ending the program
                       If data has been changed or if new data has been entered and not saved
                       yet, the program will issue a notice to that effect. Select [Yes] to activate the
                       dialog Save file as .... You can save the file and your changes. The program
                       closes after that. Select [No] to quit the program without saving the file or
                       your changes. Choose [Abort] to stop the End process and go on working
                       with the program.

                        nal Order
                        Production Terminal Order permits to book large quantities. Processing steps
                        linked with the registration point will be registered automatically.
                        The menus in Production Terminal Order are identical with the menus in Pro-
                        duction Terminal IG which is why they are not described here again in detail.
                         “Overview: Production Terminal IG” on page L-1414
                        Menu entry Notes
                        The entry Notes is on the Extras menu. With this entry, you can enter a note
                        for a booking. If you click the entry, a dialog opens on which you can enter the
                        text. If in Production Terminal Order you then click [Produce], the text is written
                        to the table awbar_historie. With such note texts, you can save special produc-
                        tion circumstances or quality features for later evaluation. For all other book-
                        ings, a new text must or can be entered.

                       •   Change language:

                           guage appears.

                       •   Information:
